javadoc: A 64-bit value where each bit is {@code 0}, {@code 1}, or {@code x} (undefined)

methods.javadoc: Create a masked long given a mask and value
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Create a masked long given a mask and value

methods.name: fromMaskAndValue
methods.comment:
Create a masked value from a mask and a long
 
 Any positions in  set to 0 create an  in the corresponding position of
 the result. Otherwise, the position takes the corresponding bit from .

methods.name: fromLong
methods.comment: Create a fully-defined value from the bits of a long

methods.javadoc:
Obtain the value as a long, where all undefined bits are treated as {@code 0}
@return the value as a long
methods.name: longValue
methods.comment: Obtain the value as a long, where all undefined bits are treated as

methods.name: getMask
methods.comment:
Get the mask as a long
 
 Positions with a defined bit are ; positions with an undefined bit are .

methods.javadoc:
True iff there are no undefined bits
@return true if fully-defined, false otherwise
methods.name: isFullyDefined
methods.comment: True iff there are no undefined bits

methods.javadoc:
True iff there are no defined bits
@return true if full-undefined, false otherwise
methods.name: isFullyUndefined
methods.comment: True iff there are no defined bits

methods.name: mask
methods.comment:
Apply an additional mask to this masked long
 
 Any  bit in  will result in an undefined bit in the result. 
 bits result in a copy of the corresponding bit in the result.

methods.name: signExtend
methods.comment:
Sign extend the masked value, according to its mask, to a full long
 
 The leftmost defined bit is taken as the sign bit, and extended to the left.

methods.name: zeroExtend
methods.comment:
Zero extend the masked value, according to its mask, to a full long
 
 All bits to the left of the leftmost defined bit are set to 0.

methods.name: unknownExtend
methods.comment: Mask out all but the lowest  bits of the value

params.name: n
params.comment: the number of bits to take (right-to-left)

methods.name: signExtend
methods.comment: Sign extend the masked value as if of the given size in bits, to a full long

params.name: n
params.comment: the number of bits to take (right-to-left)

methods.name: zeroExtend
methods.comment: Zero extend the masked value as if of the given size in bits, to a full long

params.name: n
params.comment: the number of bits to take (right-to-left)

methods.name: combine
methods.comment:
Combine this and another masked long into one, by taking defined bits from either
 
 If this masked long agrees with the other, then the two are combined. For each bit position
 in the result, the defined bit from either corresponding position is taken. If neither is
 defined, then the position is undefined in the result. If both are defined, they must agree.

throws.comment: if this and the other masked long disagree

methods.name: shiftCircular
methods.comment:
Shift  bits @{code n) positions circularly in a given direction

 The shifted bits are the least significant  bits. The remaining bits are
 unaffected.

params.name: size
params.comment: the number of bits (least significant) to include in the shift

params.name: dir
params.comment: the direction to shift (0 for left, 1 for right)

methods.name: shiftCircular
methods.comment:
Shift  bits @{code n) positions circularly in a given direction

 The shifted bits are the least significant  bits. The remaining bits are
 unaffected.

params.name: size
params.comment: the number of bits (least significant) to include in the shift

params.name: dir
params.comment: the direction to shift (0 for left, 1 for right)

methods.name: shiftLeft
methods.comment:
Shift the bits @{code n} positions left
 
 This implements both a signed and unsigned shift.

methods.name: shiftLeft
methods.comment:
Shift the bits  positions left
 
 This implements both a signed and unsigned shift.

methods.name: invShiftLeft
methods.comment:
Invert a left shift of  positions, that is shift right
 
 This is different from a normal shift right, in that it inserts unknowns at the left. The
 normal right shift inserts zeros or sign bits. Additionally, if any ones would fall off the
 right, the inversion is undefined.

methods.name: invShiftLeft
methods.comment:
Invert a left shift of  positions, that is shift right
 
 This is different from a normal shift right, in that it inserts unknowns at the left. The
 normal right shift inserts zeros or sign bits. Additionally, if any ones would fall off the
 right, the inversion is undefined.

methods.name: shiftRight
methods.comment:
Shift the bits arithmetically  positions right
 
 This implements a signed shift.

methods.name: shiftRight
methods.comment:
Shift the bits arithmetically  positions right
 
 This implements a signed shift.

methods.name: invShiftRight
methods.comment:
Invert an arithmetic right shift of  positions, that is shift left
 
 This is different from a normal shift left, in that it inserts unknowns at the right. The
 normal left shift inserts zeros. Additionally, all bits that fall off the left must match the
 resulting sign bit, or else the inversion is undefined.

methods.name: invShiftRight
methods.comment:
Invert an arithmetic right shift of  positions, that is shift left
 
 This is different from a normal shift left, in that it inserts unknowns at the right. The
 normal left shift inserts zeros. Additionally, all bits that fall off the left must match the
 resulting sign bit, or else the inversion is undefined.

methods.name: shiftRightLogical
methods.comment:
Shift the bits logically  positions right
 
 This implements an unsigned shift.

methods.name: shiftRightLogical
methods.comment:
Shift the bits logically  positions right
 
 This implements an unsigned shift.

methods.name: shiftRightPositional
methods.comment:
Shift the bits positionally  positions right
 
 This fills the left with unknown bits

methods.name: invShiftRightLogical
methods.comment:
Invert a logical right shift of  positions, that is shift left
 
 This is different from a normal shift left, in that it inserts unknowns at the right. The
 normal left shift inserts zeros. Additionally, if any ones would fall off the left, the
 inversion is undefined.

methods.name: invShiftRightLogical
methods.comment:
Invert a logical right shift of  positions, that is shift left
 
 This is different from a normal shift left, in that it inserts unknowns at the right. The
 normal left shift inserts zeros. Additionally, if any ones would fall off the left, the
 inversion is undefined.

methods.name: byteSwap
methods.comment:
Reverse the least significant  bytes
 
 This interprets the bits as an -byte value and changes the endianness. Any bits
 outside of the interpretation are truncated, i.e., become unknown.

params.name: n
params.comment: the size, in bytes, of the interpreted value.

methods.javadoc:
Compute the bitwise AND of this and another masked long To handle unknown bits, the result is derived from the following truth table: 
   0 x 1 <= A (this)
 0 0 0 0
 x 0 x x
 1 0 x 1
 ^
 B (that)
@param that the other masked long ({@code B}). @return the result.
methods.name: and
methods.comment:
Compute the bitwise AND of this and another masked long
 
 To handle unknown bits, the result is derived from the following truth table:
 
 
   0 x 1 = A (this)
 0 0 0 0
 x 0 x x
 1 0 x 1
 ^
 B (that)

methods.javadoc:
Solves the expression A & B = C, for B, given C and A To handle unknown bits, the solution is derived from the following truth table, where {@code *} indicates no solution: 
   0 x 1 <= A (that)
 0 x x 0
 x x x x
 1 * 1 1
 ^
 B (this)
@param that the other masked long ({@code B}). @return the result. @throws SolverException if no solution exists.
methods.name: invAnd
methods.comment:
Solves the expression A  B = C, for B, given C and A
 
 To handle unknown bits, the solution is derived from the following truth table, where
  indicates no solution:
 
 
   0 x 1 = A (that)
 0 x x 0
 x x x x
 1 * 1 1
 ^
 B (this)

methods.javadoc:
Compute the bitwise OR of this and another masked long To handle unknown bits, the result is derived from the following truth table: 
   0 x 1 <= A (this)
 0 0 x 1
 x x x 1
 1 1 1 1
 ^
 B (that)
@param that the other masked long ({@code B}). @return the result.
methods.name: or
methods.comment:
Compute the bitwise OR of this and another masked long
 
 To handle unknown bits, the result is derived from the following truth table:
 
 
   0 x 1 = A (this)
 0 0 x 1
 x x x 1
 1 1 1 1
 ^
 B (that)

methods.javadoc:
Solves the expression A | B = C, for B, given C and A To handle unknown bits, the solution is derived from the following truth table, where {@code *} indicates no solution: 
   0 x 1 <= A (that)
 0 0 0 *
 x x x x
 1 1 x x
 ^
 B (this)
@param that the other masked long ({@code B}). @return the result. @throws SolverException if not solution exists.
methods.name: invOr
methods.comment:
Solves the expression A | B = C, for B, given C and A
 
 To handle unknown bits, the solution is derived from the following truth table, where
  indicates no solution:
 
 
   0 x 1 = A (that)
 0 0 0 *
 x x x x
 1 1 x x
 ^
 B (this)

methods.javadoc:
Compute the bitwise XOR of this and another masked long To handle unknown bits, the result is derived from the following truth table: 
   0 x 1 <= A (this)
 0 0 x 1
 x x x x
 1 1 x 0
 ^
 B (that)
@param that the other masked long ({@code B}). @return the result.
methods.name: xor
methods.comment:
Compute the bitwise XOR of this and another masked long
 
 To handle unknown bits, the result is derived from the following truth table:
 
 
   0 x 1 = A (this)
 0 0 x 1
 x x x x
 1 1 x 0
 ^
 B (that)

methods.javadoc:
Negate the value
@return the result.
methods.name: negate
methods.comment: Negate the value

methods.javadoc:
Compute the bitwise NOT To handle unknown bits, the result is derived from the following truth table: 
 0 x 1 <= A (this)
 1 x 0
@return the result.
methods.name: not
methods.comment:
Compute the bitwise NOT
 
 To handle unknown bits, the result is derived from the following truth table:
 
 
 0 x 1 = A (this)
 1 x 0

methods.name: add
methods.comment: Compute the arithmetic sum of this and another masked long

methods.name: subtract
methods.comment: Compute the arithmetic difference: this masked long minus another

methods.name: multiply
methods.comment: Compute the arithmetic product of this and another masked long

methods.name: divideUnsigned
methods.comment: Compute the unsigned arithmetic quotient: this masked long divided by another

methods.name: invMultiplyUnsigned
methods.comment:
Compute the arithmetic quotient as a solution to unsigned multiplication
 
 This is slightly different than #divideUnsigned(MaskedLong) in its treatment of
 unknowns.

return.comment: a solution to that*x == this, if possible

methods.name: agrees
methods.comment:
Checks if this and another masked long agree
 
 Two masked longs agree iff their corresponding defined bit positions are equal. Where either
 or both positions are undefined, no check is applied. In the case that both masked longs are
 fully-defined, this is the same as an equality check on the values.

return.comment: true if this and that agree.

methods.javadoc:
Checks if this and a long agree
 
 The masked long agrees with the given long iff the masked long's defined bit positions agree
 with the corresponding bit positions in the given long. Where there are undefined bits, no
 check is applied. In the case that the masked long is fully-defined, this is the same as an
 equality check on the value.
@param that the long
@return true if this and that agree.
methods.name: agrees
methods.comment:
Checks if this and a long agree
 
 The masked long agrees with the given long iff the masked long's defined bit positions agree
 with the corresponding bit positions in the given long. Where there are undefined bits, no
 check is applied. In the case that the masked long is fully-defined, this is the same as an
 equality check on the value.

return.comment: true if this and that agree.

methods.name: agrees
methods.comment: Check if this and another object agree

params.name: that
params.comment: a MaskedLong or Long to check.

return.comment: true if this and that agree.

methods.javadoc:
Check if the masked value falls within a given range
 
 The range is defined by a maximum and a signedness. The maximum must be one less than a
 positive power of 2. In other words, it defines a maximum number of bits, including the sign
 bit if applicable.
 
 The defined bits of this masked long are then checked to fall in the given range. The
 effective value is derived by sign/zero extending the value according to its mask. In
 general, if any {@code 1} bits exist outside of the given max, the value is rejected, unless
 that {@code 1} is purely a result of signedness.
@param max the maximum value, taken as an unsigned long.
@param signed true to interpret the masked value as signed.
@return true if the masked value "fits" into the given range.
methods.name: isInRange
methods.comment:
Check if the masked value falls within a given range
 
 The range is defined by a maximum and a signedness. The maximum must be one less than a
 positive power of 2. In other words, it defines a maximum number of bits, including the sign
 bit if applicable.
 
 The defined bits of this masked long are then checked to fall in the given range. The
 effective value is derived by sign/zero extending the value according to its mask. In
 general, if any  bits exist outside of the given max, the value is rejected, unless
 that  is purely a result of signedness.

params.name: max
params.comment: the maximum value, taken as an unsigned long.

params.name: signed
params.comment: true to interpret the masked value as signed.

return.comment: true if the masked value "fits" into the given range.

methods.javadoc:
"Compare" two masked longs
 
 This is not meant to reflect a numerical comparison. Rather, this is just to impose an
 ordering for the sake of storing these in sorted collections.
methods.name: compareTo
methods.comment:
"Compare" two masked longs
 
 This is not meant to reflect a numerical comparison. Rather, this is just to impose an
 ordering for the sake of storing these in sorted collections.

methods.javadoc:
Check for equality
 
 This will only return true if the other object is a masked long, even if this one is
 fully-defined, and the value is equal to a given long (or {@link Long}). The other masked
 long must have the same mask and value to be considered equal. For other sorts of "equality"
 checks, see {@link #agrees(Object)} and friends.
methods.name: equals
methods.comment:
Check for equality
 
 This will only return true if the other object is a masked long, even if this one is
 fully-defined, and the value is equal to a given long (or Long). The other masked
 long must have the same mask and value to be considered equal. For other sorts of "equality"
 checks, see #agrees(Object) and friends.

methods.comment: Sign extend a number of the given size in bits, to a full long

return.comment: the sign-extended value as a long

methods.name: zeroExtend
methods.comment: Zero extend a number of the given size in bits, to a full long

params.name: bits
params.comment: the number of bits to take (right-to-left)

return.comment: the zero-extended value as a long

Set all undefined bits to 0
